description: Schema for the rel.definition-classification frame: definitional and classification relations of the form 'X is a Y' or 'X is a type of Y'.

frame_type.description: Canonical frame type identifier for definitional / classification relations.

frame_family.description: Optional high-level family label; always relational for this frame.

subject.description: The entity being defined or classified (often the article's main subject).

definitional_relation.description: High-level label describing the semantic relation between subject and supertype(s), e.g. instance-of, subclass-of, role-of, alias-of.

supertype_entities.description: Entity-level supertypes that the subject belongs to (e.g. specific organizations, classes, or categories represented as entities).

supertype_lemmas.description: Lemma-level labels for the type(s) that the subject belongs to (e.g. writer, political party, programming language).

modifier_lemmas.description: Lemma-level modifiers that refine or qualify the supertype(s) (e.g. british, fictional, roman_catholic).

gloss.description: Optional short textual gloss or fallback definition snippet when structured classification data is insufficient.

attributes.description: Arbitrary structured attributes related to this definitional fact (e.g. source, source_property, confidence).

extra.description: Free-form metadata / provenance bag passed through unchanged (e.g. original AbstractWiki blobs, Wikidata statements).

entity.description: Generic entity reference (person, organization, place, class, etc.).

id.description: Local identifier for the entity, if any.

qid.description: External identifier such as a Wikidata QID.

kind.description: Optional kind label (e.g. person, organization, class).

extra.description: Arbitrary metadata attached to the entity.
